comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Last name should be "Talbott" See New-York tribune., November 15, 1914, Page 2, Image 14 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030214/1914-11-15/ed-... for another photo of him.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Talbott was in the military for both World Wars and the Korean War, primarily in procurement. See www.daytonhistorybooks.com/halloffamenelsontalbott.html He retired as a Brigadier-General shortly before he died. During WWI he kept up his football as a coach. See www.daytontriangles.com/talbottsherman.htm "Talbott Coached the Army's Camp Sherman Football Team (1917-18) Chillicothe, Ohio." And later he coached at the University of Dayton and a (now defunct) profesional team, the Dayton Triangles. www.leatherheadsofthegridiron.com/?p=354 www.umkc.edu/whmckc/twa/.../KC0453-1952.07.10.pdf has a 1952 obituary.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: LoC has photos of his Dayton home, taken in 1930. www.loc.gov/pictures/item/gsc1994011929/PP/ www.loc.gov/pictures/item/gsc1994011930/PP/

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: And I now find a Wikipedia page under a nickname en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bud_Talbott

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: content.daytonmetrolibrary.org/cdm/singleitem/collection/... has a 1913 photo of him with a friend after the two of them used a canoe to rescue people during the flood in Dayton.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks so much swanq. We'll just fill in the name and add the date to the record the next time we update.  But your research has given this man a life way beyond football.  Thank you!
